title: Do YOU get enough Keen in your diet?
content:
Recent scientific study has revealed that Keen addicts do the following things, check this list to see if you're addicted.

1.) I'm reading this with my hand on my mouse

2.) I didn't blink while reading this sentence.

3.) I have both my arms in front of me right now.

4.)I'm slouching

5.) I have more than one window open, but this window is fullscreen.

6.) I have my feet apart right now.


So, how did you score?

A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: Re: Do YOU get enough Keen in your diet?
content: 3[center]<font color="MAROON">TOUGH GUYS DON'T FOLLOW FADS</font>[/center]

title: Eating Keen? That's just wrong.
content:
Huh? What's any of that got to do with Keen? I scored zero (or maybe one, depending on the interpretation of 3.).

1. Actually, I was sitting back.
2. The word 'blink' reminded me to do so.
3. Well, they're not behind my back... but my left hand was resting on the arm of my chair.
4. My monitor is at eye level, and only two feet before me, so no slouching for me.
5. Maximising Firefox would be an incredible waste of [img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v192/Jimage/keenlike/illustration/SpleenDesktop.png[/img].
6. My left leg was crossed over my right.

*looks up* Hey, it's Levellord's theory! *pulls out shotgun, shoots down said theory*

title: Re: Eating Keen? That's just wrong.
content:
Oh garg, now that's a big screen! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-surprise.gif[/img]

Hmmm.
1. Yes.
2. I didn't blink.
3. I don't have.
4. Dunno what that means.
5. Opera has tabs, so why not. I like my windows full screen.
6. I don't have.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Eating Keen? That's just wrong.
content:
1.) My hand is on the mouse.
2.) I didn't blink.
3.) Both arms are in front of me.
4.) I am indeed slouching
5.) This window is full screen. I have other windows opened, but they aren't from any browser...
6.) My feet are apart.

6/6. All without consuming a single piece of Keen.--------------

title: Re: Do YOU get enough Keen in your diet?
content:
1) True.
2) True, I think. I don't usually pay attention to this, because when I do, I can't do it without thinking anymore, just like the reflex for swallowing spit, which doesn't work anymore when you think about it, and it takes a long time to forget about it and do it without thinking again, which is really annoying.
3) True.
4) False, I change from doing that and sitting upright every now and again.
5) True. Other windows would be fullscreen, but are minimized. Actually maybe IE wasn't... not 100% sure.
6) False, I have them locked sort of for some reason.

That's 4 out of 6; that means I'm straight.Retodon8
Sheep happens!

title: Hmm.
content:
[hr]Genius Spleen, what size resolution/monitor do you have?
[hr]I'm running at 1800x1440 on a 20" monitor (For a 10-year old CRT one it handles surprisingly well). I could go up to 2048x1536, but then it starts looking interlaced and unpleasant.

It's strange how everyone else seems to be scoring relatively high on this thing. I guess I missed. Looking back, a shotgun was a pretty bad choice for shooting something like that down.

Now where'd I put that nuke silo?

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
I told you; its based on actual scientific research. There's bound to be a few of us that aren't addicted to Keen,but the majority of us are well and truly hooked.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
I'm running at 1800x1440 on a 20" monitor (For a 10-year old CRT one it handles surprisingly well).

Wow, that's pretty good - although what refresh rate is that? My 20/21" CRT is also about 10 years old, but I can't push it above 1600x1200 or the refresh rate drops below 80Hz and my annoyingly sensitive eyes start to see the screen flicker.

title: Re: Hmm.
content: It's happily cruising along at 90Hz. Windows tries to tell me it won't support higher than 60 on this res, but I switched off the 'Hide' setting so I can get up to 100.

title: Re: Hmm.
content:
Getting a bit off-topic here, but... are you sure the actual refresh rate corresponds with what you selected then?
Normally the monitor just gives an "Out of range" or perhaps "No signal", but I'm pretty sure that after disabling the Windows option to only show supported (according to it) resolutions/refresh rates, I was looking at something closes to 60 Hz than 70/75 or whatever it was I wanted to try, although Windows showed the latter.
(70 is OK for me, but 60 gives me headaches pretty quickly.)Retodon8
Sheep happens!
[url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: Gah! It's horrible! Why didn't somebody tell me!?
content:
Hmm, I believe you may be right. Looks like it only actually goes up to 75Hz, and then only at 1600 or below. At first I tested it by seeing how much it flickers in my lateral vision, but then I found the on-screen settings actually display the refresh rate.

Somehow I'd managed to ignore it before, but when I return to 1800 I can see the screen refreshing again. Damn you for ruining my illusion! Though, now that I think about it, this thing had been screwing with my head lately. I think I'm gonna have to switch down to 1600 and buy a new monitor now.

title: Re: Gah! It's horrible! Why didn't somebody tell me!?
content:
Heh, I thought 1800@90Hz was a bit high - even the top end Sony CRTs don't usually do that!

Also I've noticed that when you start off with a low refresh rate like that you don't really notice it at first, but once you stare at a good refresh rate for a little while it makes the low refresh rates *really* stand out when you go back.

But of course most modern video cards are very flexible, so if you run the right utilities you can increase your resolution by a few pixels at a time until your refresh rate drops as low as you dare - I ran my old 19" CRT at 1760x1320@82.4Hz (gotta love Linux) as that was the largest res I could get above 80Hz.

Oh, and if you're looking at a new monitor, I'm saving up for [url=http://www1.ap.dell.com/content/products/compare.aspx/30lcd_au?c=au&l=en&s=dhs]this one[/url] which is a 30" widescreen LCD (so refresh rate is irrelevant) and it runs at 2560x1600, which is mighty impressive!

title: Re: Gah! It's horrible! Why didn't somebody tell me!?
content:
One point for each of the first four, no points for the last two.
